Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.

Bakonzi misusu ya U.S mpe ba oyo balobaka makambo basepeli ten a U.S mpo ete bango batiaki elikia mingi na biloko oyo ezali kouta libanda ya mboka lekola biloko ya kosalisa bokono ya ntina makasi, ya Chine.
An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
Etid ya kosala nzela esalemaki mpona kolandela ndenge virisi epalangani ezalaki na Journal ya Kosala Nzela ya Kolongono na katikati ya sanza ya liboso 2020.
Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
Na oyo Association ya nzela ya pepo elobaki na 2018, Bangkok, hong kong, Tokyo, na Taipei bazalaki na bato mingi oyo bautaki Wuhan.
Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
Dubai, Sydney, na Melbourne bazalaki mpe bisika oyo bato mingi bazalaki kosala nzela uta Wuhan.

Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.

Bali ezalaki mboka oyo bato bazalaki kokende mingi ten a bisika populaire y aba egumba 20 oyo basosolaki na ndenge ya kobongama, ntango ba egumba na Australie emonanaki kozala na likama makasi. Australie abimisaki ya ye Plan ya mosala mpona likama ya coronavirisi ya sika (COVID-19) mokolo ya 7 sanza ya mibale.
It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
Elobaki ete esengelaki mingi eyebana na cOVID-19, mpe Australie ekokotisa mibeko ya nzela ya ngambo mpe ya koyebisa bato makambo ya pandemic.
On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
Na mokolo ya 21 sanza ya misato, likama ya biosecurite ya bato ebandaki na Australie.

Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
Ezalaki na konfinema ya babis na Wuhan mpe na Hubei, bamboka mingi babongamaki kobimisa bato na bango ya politik na bisika wana, liboso na mpepo ya mboka, na kondima ya bakonzi ya Chine.
Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
Canada, Etats Unis, Japan, Inde, Sri Lanka, Australie, France, Argentine, Germany, na Thailand bazalaki bato ya liboso oyo babimisaki bato na bango.
Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
Pakistan elobaki ete ekobimisa moto na bango moko na a Chine.
On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
Na mokolo ya 7 sanza ya mibale, Brazil ebimisaki bato ya Brazil 34 to baboti na linsungi ya bato ya Poland minei, moto ya Chine moko, mpe moto ya Inde.
The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
Bato ya Poland, Chine na ya Inde babongamaki na Poland, bato ya Brazil bazwaki basukisaki mpepo mpe bakeyi na Brazil.
Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
Bato ya Brazil oyo bakendaki Wuhan bakotaki konfinema na esika moko pene na esika ya bato ya limpimgo ya Brazil.
On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.

Na mokolo wana mpe, 215 bato ya Canada (176 oyo bazalaki na mpepo, mpe 39 oyo bazalaki na mpepo mosusu ya gouvernema ya U.S) babimisaki bango Wuhan na kokende konfinema na CFB Trenton mpona ba mposo mibale.
On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
Mokolo ya 11 sanza ya mibale, mpepo mosusu na bato ya Canada 185 oyo bautaki Wuhan basukaki na CB Trenton.
Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
Bakonzi ya Australoe babimisaki baton a bango 277 na mokolo ya 3 na 4 ya sanza ya mibale na esika ya kosimba bato ya Christmas Island, oyo ebongamaki mpona konfinema, bazalaki kuna mikolo 14.
A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.

Na Nouvelle Zeland mpepo oyo ezalaki kobimisa bato ekomaki mokolo ya 5 sanza ya mibale; bato oyo bazalaki na kati (misusu mpe ya Australie mpe Pacific) bakendaki konfinema na Whangaparoa, Nord ya Auckland.
On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
Na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya mibale, Etats Unis elobaki ekobimisa bato ya Amerik oyo bazala na bwato ya Diamond Pricess.
On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
Na mokolo ya 21 sanza ya mibale, mpepo oyo ememaki bato ya Canada 129 oyo bautaki Diamond Princess bakomaki na Trenton, Ontario.

In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
Na ebandeki ya sanza ya misato, gouvernema ya Italie abandaki kobimisa bato na Iran. Na mokolo ya 14 sanza ya misato Mpepo ya Sid Afrik oyo ya gouvernema ya Sid Afrik ebimisaki bato ya Sid Afrik 112.
Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
Baekzame esalemaki, mpe bato minei ya Sid Afrik oyo bazalaki na basymptomi ya coronavirisi batikalaki mpona kobatela basusu.
Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
Kaka bato ya Sid Afrik oyo ekzame elobaki ete bazali na malady te babimaki.

Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.

Baekzame esungaki bato ya Sid Afrik mpe bato oyo bazalaki komema mpe kosala na kati yam pepo basalaki ekzame, bato ya hotel, police, bambila oyo bazalaki na mosala, ezalaki mpona komibatela, nyonso batikalaki kososola bango mpona mikolo 14 na Ranch Resort.
On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
Na mokolo ya 20 sanza ya misato, Etats Unies ebandaki kobenda bato ba bango na Irap likolo ya pandemi.
On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
Na mokolo ya 5 sanza ya mibale, minister ya bapaya ya Chine elobaki ete bamboka 21 (Delarus, Pakistan, Trinidad mpe Tobago, Egypt, Iran mpe na kati) batindaki lisungi na Chine.

Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.

Bana ya kelasi misusu ya Chine na Universite na Amerik basanganako mpona kontinda lisungi na bisika ya Chine oyo bazalaki na virisi makasi, mpe na lisanga mosusu na Chicago batindaki bamask 50,000 N95 na balepital na Hubei mokolo ya 30 sanza ya liboso. Organization ya kosunga bato Direct Relie, na bomoko ya FedEX, batindaki bamask 200,000 mpe na biloko misusu ya kobatela nzoto, lekola bagan, barobe, na mpepo ya biloko ya likama na lepital ya Union ya Wuhan mokolo ya 30 sanza ya liboso.
On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".

Na mokolo ya 5 sanza ya mibale, Bill na Melinda Gates balobaki ete bapesi OMS $100 milio mpona etid ya vaccine mpe mosala ya kosalisa mpe na ‘’kobatela bapopulation oyo bazali na likama na Afrik mpe na Sud ya Asie’’.
Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
Interaksyon alobaki ete gouvernema ya chine epesaki 200,000 mask na Philippines na mokolo ya 6 sanza ya mibale, nsima oyo Senateur Richard Gordon atindaki bamask 3.16milio na Wuhan.
On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
Na mokolo ya 19 sanza ya mibale, Croix Rouge ya Singapore elobaki ete babongisa $2.26 milio mpona kosalisa Chine.

Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.

Japan epesaki bamask ya million moko na Wuhan, Turkey epesaki biloko ya kosalisa bokono, Russie epesaki 13 tonnes ya biloko ya kosalisa bokono na Wuhan, Malasie elobaki ekopesa 18 milion ya bagan na Chine, Germany epesaki biloko ya kosalisa mingi lekola 10,000 robe ya hazmat, mpe Etats Unis epesaki 17.8 tons ya biloko ya kosalisa bokono na Chine mpe balobaki ete mbongo $100 milio ezali na nzela mpona ba mboka oyo bazali na likama. Nsima bato ya kobela na Wuhan esukaki makasi, mboka etikalaki kotinda lisungi na ba mboka ebele oyo bazalaki na pandemi.
In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
Na sanza ya misato, Chine, Cuba na Russie batindaki biloko ya kosalisa maladi mpe minganga mpo na kosalisa bato ya Italie na kobunda na coronavirisi.
Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
Moto ya mombongo Jack MA atindaki biloko ya komona maladi 1,1 milio, bamasque 6 milio, mpe bilamba ya kobatela nzoto 60 000 na Addis Abeba, na Ethiopie mpo ete Union Africaine ekabola yango.
He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
Na nsima ye atindaki biloko 5 000 ya komona maladi bamasque 100 000 mpe ba ventillateur 5 na Panama.
Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.

Monsieur Ma apesaki mpe bisaleli ya minganga na Canada. Pays-bas, Espagne, Turquie, Georgie, mpe Rèpublique tchèque balobaki ete bazalaki na mitungisi mpo na bamasque mpe biloko ya komona maladi oyo euti Chine.
For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.

Na ndakisa, Espagne baboyaki biloko 58 000 ya komona maladi ya coronavirisi oyo eutaki na Chine ezalaki kolakisa ba resultat ya solo kaka na 30%, na nsima, Pays-bas bazongisaka bamasque 600 000 ya Chine mpo ezalaki ya kobeba.
Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
Belgique ezongisaki bamasque 100 000 oyo basalelaki te, mpo bakanisaki eutaki na Chine, kasi na koloba ya solo eutaki na Colombie.
On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.

Kasi, bayamabaki malamu lisungi ya Chine na bamboka mosusu ya Amerique Latine mpe na Afrika. Na mokolo ya 2 sanza ya minei, banque mondiale ebandaki misala ya lombangu mpo na kosalisa mikili ya bobola.
The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
OMS ekumisaki milende wana ya bakonzi ya Chine na ndenge bazolandela mpe kokanga maladi mabe nzela mpo epanzana te.

The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".

OMS elobelaki bokeseni eza na kati ya kobima ya SARS 2002-2004, epai wapi bakonzi ya Chine bafundami ete bazolobela te makambo polele na milende basalaki te mpo na kobundisa mpe kokanga maladi wana nzela mpe ete maladi ya sikoyo, oyo bakonzi “bazopesa mbala na mbala bansango ya sika mpo na koboya kobangisa bato na liboso ya fete ya Ebandeli ya Mbula’’.

On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.

Na mokolo ya 23 sanza ya yambo, na kolandela ekateli oyo bakonzi bazwaki ya kopekisa transpore nyonso na Wuhan, momonisi ya OMS Gauden Galea alobaki ete ata soki ‘’ezalaki mpenza te toli oyo OMS epesaki’’, ezalaki ‘’likambo ya malamu emonisaki ete komipesa ya makasi ata soki eza esika moko’’ mpe ye abengaki yango ‘likambo oyo esalema nanu te na makambo ya kolongono ya nzoto”. Na mokolo ya 30 sanza ya liboso, ntango bayebaki ete moto apesi moto mosusu maladi wana na ibanda ya Chine mpe komata ya motango ya bato ya maladi na mikili mosusu, OMS elobaki ete maladi oyo eza Urgence de santé publique de portée internationale (USPPI), PHEIC ya motoba banda bazwa bibongiseli mpo na kosukisa grippe ya makasi ya 2009.
WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
Diretere general ya OMS Tedros Adhanom alobaki ete PHEIC ekoki “kopanzanana mokili mobimba, mingimingi na mikili ya bobola oyo baza te na balopitalo ya malamu.

In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."

Nsima ya kopekisa mibembo, Tedros alobaki ete “eza na ntina te batya mibeko oyo ezopekisa kosala mibembo mpe mombongo kati na mikili” mpe ete ‘’OMS ezopesa te nzela ya kopekisa bato mombongo to ezopesa bato nzela ya kosala mibembo.”

On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".

Na mokolo ya 5 sanza ya mibale, OMS esengaki mikili bapesa mbongo 675 milio ya badolare mpo na kosunga milende ya komibongisa mpo na mikili ya bobola, alobaki ete lisalisi eza ya lombangu na mikili wana oyo “eza te na bibongiseli mpo na koyeba bato oyo bazwi virisi wana, ata soki ekobima”.

Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.

Tedros alobaki lisusu ete ‘’toza makasi ndenge moko na lien na biso ya pete mpenza” mpe asengaki mikili “na komipesa lelo to na kofuta mingi na nsima.” Na mokolo ya 11 sanza ya mibale, na conference de presse moko, OMS elobaki ete COVID-19 eza nkombo ya maladi wana.
On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
Kaka na mokolo wana, Tedros alobaki ete secrétaire général ya ONU António Guterres andimaki kopesa “makasi ya ebongiseli mobimba ya ONU mpo na kobundisa yango.”

A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".

Ekipi ya ONU oyo ekipaka makambo ya lombango ebandaki mosaka, epesaki nzela ete ONU mobimba esangana na etumba wana, oyo OMS ete ekosalisa na kotya “likebi na makambo ya kolongono ya nzoto ntango bibongiseli mosusu ezomema mayele na bango mpo na kotala makambo etali bomoi ya bato, makambo ya mbongo, mpe ya kokolisa makambo ya mboka.”

On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".

Na mokolo ya 14 sanza ya mibale, ekipe ya OMS na Chine babandaki kosala elongo mpo na kosalisa minganga ya mikili mingi mpe ya OMS makoki ya kosalisa Chine na kobundisa maladi wana mpe kotala “makasi ya maladi wana mpe ndenge ezopesama na bato” na nzela ya ba-atelier mpe makita na bibongiseli ya ntina ya mikili mingi mpe kosala vizite mpo na koyeba “bopusi ya misala ya kobundisa maladi na etuka wana mpe na mokili wana, ata mpe na bingumba na bamboka.” Na mokolo ya 25 sanza ya mibale, OMS elobaki ete “mokili esengeli kosala makambo mingi mpo na komibongisa na maladi mabe ya coronavirisi,” alobaki ete ata tokoki nanu te kobenga yango maladi mabe, mikili esengeli “kozala ya kobongama.’’

In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.

Mpo na kobundisa maladi na Iran, OMS etindaki ekipe moko kuna mpo na kotalela likambo yango. Na mokolo ya 28 sanza ya mibale, bakonzi ya OMS balobaki ete likama ya coronavirisi na mokili mobimba eza “likolo” kasi esengeli kokoma “likolo koleka,” nivo ya makasi koleka ya bokengi mpe ya likama.
Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
Mike Ryan, diretere ya likama ya kolongono ya nzoto ya OMS ya makambo ya lombango, akebisaki na bansango ete “Oyo ezali likambo ya solo oyo mokili nyonso ya planete esengeli kolandela: Bo lamuka.
This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
Mbala mosusu virisi oyo eza na koya mpe esengele komibongisa,” alobaki ete esengeli kozwa bibongiseli ebongi oyo ekosalisa mpo “makambo ebeba te koleka ndelo” na mokili.

Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."

Ryan alobaki lisusu ete bansango ya sikoyo ezopesa te bakonzi ya makambo ya kolongono ya nzoto makoki ya koloba ete ezali malabi mabe; alobi ete koloba bongo elimboli ete “tozondima mpenza ete moto nyonso na mabele akozwa virisi oyo.’’
On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
Na mokolo ya 11 sanza ya misato, OMS elobaki ete coronavirisi eza maladi mabe.

The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.

Diretere général alobaki ete OMS “ezali komitungisa mingi na ndenge ezopanzana mingi mpe na makasi na yango, mpe na ndenge tozosala eloko moko te.” Bato mingi basepeli te na OMS mpo bamoni ete bazolandela makambo wana malamu te, na ndakisa balobaki na retard ete eza urgence na makambo ya kolongono ya nzoto mpe ete virisi oyo eza maladi mabe.
The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
Na mokolo ya 6 sanza ya minei, bato 733,000 batyaki maboko na mokanda mpo na kosenga diretere général ya OM Tedros Adhanom a demissioné.
On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Na mokolo ya 26 sanza ya misato 2020, bato mingi ya mayele ya lotomo ya bato ya ONU babetaki nsete na kotosa lotomo ya moto nyonso na ntango oyo ya maladi mabe ya COVID-19.
The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
Etuluku ya bato ya mayele balobaki ete esengeli kobikisa moto nyonso mpe baguvernema eza na mokumba wana.
The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
Bato yango balobaki ete kozanga mbongo to assurance ya maladi eza ntina ya konyokola etuluku moko ya bato.

The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.

Bato ya mayele balobaki ete moto nyonso aza na lotomo ya kozala nzoto kolongono, ata mpe bibosono, bato oyo bazali na lisanga ya bato moke, mibange, bato oyo bakima na mboka na bango moko, bato bazangi ndako, babola ya makasi, bato ya boloko, mpe ba refuzie ata mpe bato oyo etuluku na bango eyebani te, guvernema esengeli kosalisa bango.
International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
Bagouvernema ya mikili bazozwa bibongiseli mpo na kobongisa makambo ya mbongo mpe ya bomoi euti na maladi ya COVID-19.

The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world, as well as viewpoints and advice.
Organisation ya coopération économique et développement esali esika moko mpo na bansanga ya sika mpe ya malamu na makambo oyo mikili ezosala mpo na kobundisa maladi oyo, ata mpe makanisi na batoli.

From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy to addressing the effects of lockdown and restrictions on travel, the digital hub includes a Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.

Bonsomi mpo na kolendisa systeme ya kolongono ya nzoto mpe nkita ya mokili mobimba na kobundisa bopusi ya confinement mpe ya bipekiseli ya kosala mobembo, hub ya internet eza na eloko elandelaka politiki ya mboka, mpe esalisaka mikili bayekola na mikili mosusu mpe esalisa bango na kobunda na bampasi ya coronavirisi.

The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for its handling of the pandemic, which began in the Chinese province of Hubei.

Etats-Unis elobeli guvernema ya Chine mabe, ministre ya Cabinet ya Royaume-Uni Michael Gove, mpe Edouardo Bolsonaro, mwana ya prezida ya brésil Jair Bolsonaro mpo na ndenge bazobundisa maladi mabe oyo, oyo ebandaki na etuka Hubei na Chine.

A number of provincial-level administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China, a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.

Bato mosusu ya biro ya parti communiste ya Chine (PCC) balongolaki bango na mosala na ndenge bazolandela milende ya Chine ya kotya bato na quarantaine na Chine Central, elakisi ete bato bazosepela te na ndenge bakonzi bazosala makambo na bisika wana.
Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.
Bapanzi-nsango mosusu bazondima ete ntina ya likambo wana eza ya kobatela sécrétaire général ya parti communiste ya Chine Xi Jinping, mpo bato basilika ye te nde coronavirisi.

Some Chinese officials, e.g. Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy.
Bakonzi mosusu ya Chine, na ndakisa Zhao Lijian awanganaki ete coronavirisi ebandaki na Wuhan, mpe kotalela kofunda euti na Etats-Unis mpe na Italie ete COVID-19 basalaki yango kosala.

The U.S. administration of Donald Trump has referred to the coronavirus as "Chinese virus" or "Wuhan virus" saying that China's "censorship supercharged a virus that has now turned into a global pandemic", which has in turn been criticized by some critics as racism and "distract[ing] from his administration's failure to contain the disease".

Guvernema ya États-Unis ya Donald Trump elobi ete coronavirisi eza ‘virisi ya Chine” to “virisi ya Wuhan” mpe alobi ete Chine “ebongaki sekele ya virisi oyo ekomi maladi mabe na mokili mobimba,” bato mosusu balobi ete maloba wana eza koyina bato mpo na loposo na bango mpe “ezozipa foti ya guvernema na ye ndenge bazokoka te kobundisa maladi oyo.”

The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council, with the strategy being quoted as "Everything is about China.
Daily Beast azwaki kable moko ya gouvernema ya États-Unis emonisi masolo na conseil ya sécurite ya mboka, ebongo balobi ete masolo yango nyonso “Ezalaki kolobela kaka Chine.

We're being told to try and get this messaging out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.

Bazoyebisa biso tomeka mpe tolongola nsango wana na ndenge nyonso, ezala na conference de presse mpe na televizio.” Politico, mayele ya bapaya, mpe bloomberg balobi ete milende ya Chine ezosala mpo na kotinda lisalisi na mikili oyo virisi ekoteli bango eza na kati ya kampanye bazosala mpo bazala na bopusi na mokili mobimba.
EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned that there is "a geo-political component including a struggle for influence through spinning and the 'politics of generosity'".
Josep Borrell moto ya Eunion Européenne atalaka makambo ya bapaya akebisaki ete eza ‘’likambo ya koluka kozwa nguya na nzila ya espionage mpe ‘mayele ya kokaba.’”
Borrell also said that "China is aggressively pushing the message that, unlike the US, it is a responsible and reliable partner."
Borell alobaki mpe ete “Chine ezotinda kotinda maloba na makasi ete, na kokesena na États-Unis, aza moninga ya malamu mpe ya kotyela motema.’’
China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.
Chine esengi mpe États-Unis alongola bitumbu oyo etyela Syrie, Venezuela mpe Iran, mpe alobi ete atindi lisungi na mikili mibale oyo ya nsuka.
Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.
Bamasque 100 000 oyo Jack Ma atindaki na Cuba, bakangaki yango na mokolo ya 3 sanza ya minei mpo na etumbu ya États-Unis.
US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid meant for other nations to their own country.
Bafundi mpe bakonzi ya États-Unis ete bazobotola lisalisi oyo batindelaki mikili mosusu mpo na bango moko.
And there have been mask-related disputes reported between other countries, such as Germany, Austria and Switzerland; and the Czech Republic and Italy.
Mpe baloki ete bamboka mosusu mpe baswana mpo na bamasque, na ndakisa Allemagne, Austriche, na Swisse; mpe Republique tcheque na Italie.
In addition, Turkey seized hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.
Lisusu, Turquie akangaki ba ventillateur oyo esengaki ekende na Espagne.
In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy.
Na ebandeli ya sanza ya misato, guvernema ya Italie esepelaki te na kozanga bomoko ya Union Européenne na likambo ya maladi ya coronavirisi na Italie.
Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that "Only China responded bilaterally.
Maurizio Massari, Ambasadere ya Italie na Union Européenne, alobaki ete “Chine mpamba esalaki makambo mpo na bolamu na bango mibale.
Certainly, this is not a good sign of European solidarity."
Ya solo, eza te elembo malamu te mpo na bomoko ya Eropa.’’

On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.

Na mokolo ya 22 sanza ya misato, nsima ya kosolola na telefone na Ministre ya liboso Giuseppe Conte, prezida ya Russie, Vladimir Putin atindaki basoda ya Russie oyo baza minganga, mituka ya koboma mikrobe, mpe biloko mosusu ya kosalisa kolongono ya nzoto na Italie.
Italy's La Stampa newspaper cited an anonymous "high-level political source" that 80 percent of Russia's aid was "useless or of little use to Italy".

Zulunalo ya Italie La Stampa elobaki ete “mokonzi moko ya monene ya politiki” oyo aboyaki kopesa nkombo, alobaki ete 80 pourcent ya lisungi ya Rissue “ezalaki na ntina te to ntina moke mpo na Italie.”
The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.
Moto yango afundaki Russie ete ezobanda bitumba mpo na ‘kozwa bamboka mpe kolonga na politiki.”
The President of Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, and Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio dismissed the media reports and expressed their gratitude.
Prezida ya Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, na ministre ya bapaya Luigi Di Maio bawanganaki bansango wana mpe bapesaki botondi na bango.
Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.
Russie mpe atindaki mpe mpepo na biloko ya kosalisa kolongono ya nzoto na Etats-Unis.

Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that "when offering assistance to US colleagues, [Putin] assumes that when US manufacturers of medical equipment and materials gain momentum, they will also be able to reciprocate if necessary."

Molobi ya Kremlin, Dimitry Peskov, alobaki ete “ntango batindaki lisalisi na baninga na bango”ya États-Unis, [Putin] akanisaki ete ntango bakompani ya États-Unis ekozongela mosala na bango ndenge ezalaka, bakosala mpe bongo soki esengeli.”
The planned NATO "Defender 2020" military exercise in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, the largest NATO war exercise since the end of the Cold War, will be held on a reduced scale.

Ngalisisi ya basoda ya OTAN oyo esengelaki kosalema na “Defender 2020” na Allemagne, Pologne, mpe na Pays Baltes, ngalasisi ya monene koleka oyo OTAN asala na nsima ya nsuka ya bitumba ebengami guerre froide, ekosalema na date mosusu.

The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament's general secretary Kate Hudson criticized the Defender 2020 exercise: "In the current public-health crisis, it jeopardizes the lives not only of the troops from the US and the many European countries participating but the inhabitants of the countries in which they are operating."The Iranian government has been heavily affected by the virus, with around two dozen parliament members infected as well as fifteen other current or former political figures.

Kate Hudson, sécretaire général ya kampanye mpo na kosilisa mandoki ya Nikleyere alobaki mabe mpo na ngalasisi wana ya Defender 2020: “Na mpasi ya sikoyo ya kolongono ya nzoto, eza kotya na likama kaka te bomoi ya basoda bauti na États-Unis mpe na mikili mingi ya Eropa oyo bazosangana kasi mpe ya bato ya mikili oyo bakosala yango.” “Kala mingi te guvernema ya Iran etungisamaki mingi na virisi oyo, mpe bato zomi na mibale ya parlema baza na maladi wana mpe bato zomi na mitano mosusu ya politiki ya sika mpe ya kala.

Iran's President Hassan Rouhani wrote a public letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, saying that his country is struggling to fight the outbreak due to lack of access to international markets as a result of the United States sanctions against Iran.The outbreak has prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other wealthy countries, including universal health care, universal child care, paid family leave, and higher levels of funding for public health.

Prezida ya Iran, Hassan Rouhani, akomaki mokamda ya polele na bakonzi ya mokili mobimba mpo na kosenga lisungi na mokolo ya 14 sanza ya misato 2020, alobaki ete mboka na ye ezokoka te kobundisa maladi oyo mpo bazangi likoki ya kokota na bazando ya mokili mobimba mpo na bitumbu ya États-Unis epesa Iran. Kobima ya maladi oyo ezosenga États-Unis basalela mayele ya malamu mpo na bato na mikili mosusu ya bozwi, ata mpe kolongono ya nzoto ya mokili mobimba, kolongono ya nzoto ya bana, congé ya kofuta mpo na libota, mpe lisengi makasi ya kozwa mosolo mpe kolongono ya nzoto ya bato nyonso.

Political analysts anticipated it may negatively affect Donald Trump's chances of re-election in the 2020 presidential election.Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea worsened due to the pandemic.

Bato oyo basosolaka makambo ya politiki bakanisaki ete ekoki kokitisa ba chance oyo Donald Trump aza na yango mpo na maponi ya 2020. Boyokani na ye na Japon mpe Corée ya sude ebebi makasi mpo na maladi mabe oyo.
South Korea criticized Japan's "ambiguous and passive quarantine efforts" after Japan announced anybody coming from South Korea will be placed in two weeks' quarantine at government-designated sites.

Corée ya sude elobaki mabe mpo na “milende eyebani te mpe ya kozanga ntina ya quarantaine” ya Japon ntango Japon alobaki ete bato nyonso oyo bauti na Corée ya sude bakotya bango na quarantaine mposo mibale na bisika oyo guvernema ekobongisa.
The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
Na ebandeli bato ya Corée ya sude basepelaki te na makambo prezida Moon Jae-in asalaki mpo na kobundisa virisi.

Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.

Bato mingi ya Corée batyaki maboko na mokanda oyo ezosenga Moon atika mosala mpo bango bamoni azokoka te kobundisa maladi oyo, to mpo na kokumisa makambo azosala. Maladi oyo epesi mikili nzela ya kobimisa mbeko mpo na kobundisa yango.
Some commentators have expressed concerns that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.
Bato mosusu balobaki bazali komitungisa mpo yango epesi baguvernema libaku ya kokangama na bokonzi na bango.

In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.

Na Hongrie, parlema esalaki vote mpo na kopesa premier ministre, Viktor Orbán, nzela na koyangela libela, na kolongola bato ya parlema mosala mpe koboya maponi esalema mpe kopesa etumbu na bato oyo amoni ete bapanzaki bansango ya lokuta mpo na virisi mpe ndenge guvernema ezolandela maladi oyo.

The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed for several instances of supply shortages, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreaks, panic buying, and disruption to factory and logistic operations.

Kobima ya coronavirisi esali ete bafunda bato mingi mpo na kozanga bisaleli, banda na mposa makasi ya kozala na bisaleli mpo na kobundisa maladi oyo, kosomba bisomba-somba, mpe kozanga biloko na ba-izine mpe biloko mosusu.
The United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption.
Ministere ya bilei mpe ya bankisi ya États-Unis epesi likebi mpo na kozanga bankisi mpe bisaleli mpo bato basengi biloko mingi koleka mpe stoke esili.
Several localities also witnessed panic buying that led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water, inducing supply shortages.
Na bisika mingi mpe bato bakomi kosomba bisomba-somba, yango esali ete biloko esila na ba magazin, ndakisa bilei, papier ya wese, mpe milangi ya mai mpe stoke ya biloko.
The technology industry in particular has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.
Industrie ya teknolozi ekebisi makasi ndenge biloko ya elektronike ezoumela na kokoma.
According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen 100-fold.
Mpo na diretere général ya OMS Tedros Adhanom, mposa ya bilamba ya kobatela nzoto emati mbala 100.
This demand has led to the increase in prices of up to twenty times the normal price and also induced delays on the supply of medical items for four to six months.
Mposa oyo esali ete bantalo ya biloko emata mbala zomi na mibale mpe elobaki ete bisaleli ya kimonganga ekozala na retard ya basanza minei to motoba.
It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.
Esali pe ete na mokili mobimba bato bazanga bilamba ya kobatela nzoto, mpe OMS ekebisi ete ekotya kolongono ya nzoto ya minganga na likama.
In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.
Na Australie, maladi mabe epesi libaku na bateki ya daigou bateka biloko ya Australie na Chine.

The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.

Yango esali ete bazanga bilei ya babebe na bazando mosusu ya minene mpe guvernema ya Australie apekisaki yango. Ata bato mingi mpenza bazozwa COVID-19 na norde ya Italie mpe na Wuhan, mpe ezosenga bilei ezanga; bisika nyonso mibale wana bazangi mpenza bilei.

Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.
Bibongiseli bazwi na Chine mpe na Italie esalisa na kolonga na kobundisa mombongo wana ya mabe ya biloko ya ntina, kosala ete bilei esila te na Eropa mpe na Amerika ya norde ndenge bakanisaki.
Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.
Norde ya Italie na ndenge basalaki mingi misala ya bilanga ekiti mingi mpenza, kasi bantalo ekoki komata na kotalela biloko oyo ezobima.
Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.
Ba etagere ezangi bilei esalemaki kaka moke, ata na engumba, mpe bakonzi ya Chine babimisaki bangulu oyo babombaka mpo bato nyonso bazanga te bilei.
Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.
Mibeko ya ndenge moko eza na Italie oyo ezosenga bato basalaka bilei babombaka bilei mpo na ntango ya mpasi.

Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.

Mpasi oyo ebimi na nkita ya mokili mobimba ya esimbi mpe Chine: bansango ya bapanzi-nsango elobi ete na mokolo ya 16 sanza ya misato, nkita ya Chine ebebaki makasi na basanza mibale ya liboso ya 2020 mpo na bikateli guvernema ezwaki mpo na kokanga virisi nzela epanzana te, mpe ntalo ya biloko emataki na 20,5%.
As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
Eteni ya Chine oyo eza na mabele eza eteni ya monene na nkita ya mpe na bakompani na ngo, kobima ya virisi ezobebisa makasi mpenza nkita ya mokili mobimba.
Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
Agathe Demarais ya de serivice ya renseignement ya makambo ya nkita elobi ete bazando ekozala kaka bongobongo kino makambo ekozonga ndenge ezalaka.
In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.
Na sanza ya liboso 2020, bato mosusu balobaki ete kokwea ya nkita na mokili mobimba ekoki koleka oyo esalemaki na kobima ya SARS na 2002-2004.
One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.
Bolukiluki moko na iniversite ya Washington na St. Louis alobi ete tokozanga mbongo koleka badolare 300 miliard na bisaleli na mokili, mbongo tokokaki kosalela mbula mibale.
The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
Lisanga ya mikili oyo etekaka petrole (OPEP) elobi ete “bakwea” ndenge ntaolo ya essance ekoti mpo bato ya Chine bazosenga yango mingi lisusu te.
Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside mainland China.
Zando ya mokili mobimba ebebaki na mokolo ya 24 sanza ya mibale mpo na motango ya bato oyo bazalaki na COVID-19 emataki mingi na Chine.

On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the coronavirus outbreak, various U.S. stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the Dow falling 1,191 points, the largest one-day drop since the financial crisis of 2007–08.

Na mokolo ya 27 sanza ya mibale, mpo na basusi mingi na ntina ya kobima ya coronavirisi, ba indice mingi ya bazando ya Etats-Unis ata mpe NASDAQ-100, S& indice P 500, mpe Dow Jones ekitaki makasi na ndenge esala te banda 2008, mpe Dow ekitaki na bapoint 1 191, kokita makasi na mokolo moko mpamba banda mpasi oyo ezalaki na 2007-08.
All three indexes ended the week down more than 10%.
Ba indice nyonso misato esukisaki mposo na nse ya 10%.
On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a Negative Outlook.
Na mokolo ya 28 sanza ya mibale, Scope Ratings GmbH endimaki valeur ya guvernema ya Chine, kasi ezalaki kaka malamu te.
Stocks plunged again based on coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.
Biloko esilaki lisusu mpo na bobangi ya coronavirisi, kokita ya makasi ezalaki na mokolo ya 16 sanza ya misato.
Many consider an economic recession to be likely.
Bato mingi bakanisi ete nkita ekowea mpenza.
Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks' and states' timely emergency measures.
Moto ya Nkita Mohamed El-Erian akumisaka babanke centrales mpe mikili mpo na bibongiseli ya malamu bazwaki na lombango.
Central banks are reacting more quickly than they did to the 2008 financial crash.
Babanke ya centrales bazosala makambo noki koleka ndenge basalaki na mpasi ya nkita ya 2008.
Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against any travel all over the world.

Tourisme ezali esika ekonyokwama makasi mpenza mpo na bipekiseli ya kosala mibembo, mpe bakangi bisika ya bato mingi ata mpe bisika ya kitoko ya kokende kotala, mpe ndenge baguvernema ezopekisa kosala mobembo na mokili mobimba.
As a consequence, numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas, while British regional airline Flybe collapsed.

Yango wana, bampepo mingi ekati mibembo na yango mpo bato moke nde baza na mposa ya kosala mobembo, ata mpe British Airways, Chinese Eastern Airlines, mpe Quantas, kasi British regional airline Flybe ekwei.
The impact on the cruise line industry was at a level never seen before.
Bopusi na yango na mobembo ya mai eza makasi na nivo moko emonana nanu te.
Several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.
Bisika mingi oyo train etelemaka mpe mabongo, ekangama.
The epidemic coincided with the Chunyun, a major travel season associated with the Chinese New Year holiday.
Maladi mabe eyei nzela moko na Chunyun, eleko monene ya mobembo oyo esalamaka na ntango ya fete ya mbula ya sika na Chine.

A number of events involving large crowds were cancelled by national and regional governments, including annual New Year festivals, with private companies also independently closing their shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.

Makambo mingi oyo esangisaka bato mingi, bapekisaki yango na bagurnema ya bituka, ata mpe bafete ya mbula ya sika; bakompani ya prive mpe ekangai baboutique na bango mpe bisika bato bayaka kotala na ndakisa Hong Kong Disneyland mpe Shanghai Disneyland.
Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions have been closed to prevent mass gatherings, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs.
Bafeti mingi ya mbula ya mpe bisika bapaya bayaka kotala, bakanga yango mpo na kopekisa bato mingi basala makita, ata mpe Forbidden City na Beijing mpe bafete ya makoko ya bokoko.
In 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities extended the New Year's holiday to 10 February, instructing most workplaces not to re-open until that date.

Na 24 na kati ya 31 bituka, bamboka mpe bisika mingi na Chine, bakonzi bapusaki feti ya mbula ya sika na mokolo ya 10 sanza ya mibale, mpe eyebisaki bisika mingi ya mosala ete efongwama te kino na date wana.
These regions represented 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.
Bituka wana ezali 80% ya bomengo ya mboka mpe 90% ya mbongo eutaka na biloko batekaka.

Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response level to the highest and declared an emergency, closing schools until March and cancelling its New Year celebrations.The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.

Hong Kong ematisaki mibeko na ye mpo na kobundisa maladi mpe elobelaki etat d’urgence, ekangaki biteyelo kino na sanza ya misato mpe epekisaki fete ya mbula ya sika. Mombongo ebebisa mpenza na mokili mobimba, ba boutique bakitisi bangonga ya mosala to bakangi yango mpo na ntango moke.
Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40%.
Kosomba biloko na ba boutique mike ekita na Eropa mpe na Amerique Latine na 40%.
North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50–60% drop.
Mombongo ya bato ya Amerika ya norde mpe ya moyen Orient oyo batekaka biloko basombi ekiti na 50-60%.
This also resulted in a 33–43% drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February.
Ememaki kokita ya 33-43% na bato ya makolo oyo bazokende na esika baboutique ezalaka na sanza ya misato soki tokokanisi yango na sanza ya mibale.

Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.According to a United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave between 14 and 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.

Bato batekaka na bazando na mokili mobimba, batyeli bango mibeko mosusu, na ndakisa kolongola mikrobe, kotya ba scanner mpo na kozwa temperature ya basombi, mpe kokanga makambo ya kosangana. Na kotalela ministere ya nkita ya Etats-Unis mpo na Amerique Latine, balobi ete mpasi ya maladi oyo ekosala ete bato kati ya 14 mpe 22 milio ya bato bakozala bobola makasi na Amerique Latine koleka soki maladi oyo ebimaki te.
In January and February 2020, during the height of the epidemic in Wuhan, about 5 million people in China lost their jobs.
Na sanza ya liboso mpe ya mibale na 2020, ntango bato mingi mpenza babelaki na Wuhan, bato pene ya bamilio 5o na Chine babungisaki mosala na bango.

Many of China's nearly 300 million rural migrant workers have been stranded at home in inland provinces or trapped in Hubei province.In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and applied for government aid.

Bato mingi na kati ya bato bamilio 300 ya Chine oyo basalaka na bamboka bakangami na bituka to na etuka ya Hubei. Na sanza ya misato 2020, bato ya Amerika koleka bamilio 10 babungisaki misala na bango mpe basengaki lisungi na guvernema.

The coronavirus outbreak could cost 47 million jobs in the United States and unemployment rate may hit 32%, according to estimates by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.The lockdown in India has left tens of millions of Indian migrant workers (who are paid through daily wages) unemployed.The survey from the Angus Reid Institute found that 44% of Canadian households have experienced some type of unemployment.Nearly 900,000 workers lost their jobs in Spain since it went into lockdown in mid-March 2020.

Kobima ya coronavirisi esali ete bato bamilio 47 babungisa misala na Etats-Unis mpe kozanga mosala emati na 32%, na kotalela bantalo euti na banke Federal ya St Louis. Confinement na Inde esali ete bamilio ya bato oyo baliaka na mosala ya (oyo bafutaka bango mokolo na mokolo) bazangi mosala. Ankete ya Institut Angus Reid emoni ete bato ya mabota ya Canada 44% bazangi mosala na lolenge moko boye. Pene ya bato ya mosala 900 000 babungisaki misala na Espagne banda confinement ebandaki na katikati ya sanza ya misato 2020.

During the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits and 1 million British workers applied for a universal credit scheme.Almost half a million companies in Germany have sent their workers on a government-subsidized short-time working schemes known as Kurzarbeit.

Na eteni ya mibale ya sanza ya misato, bato ya France bamilio 4 oyo basalaka mosala basalaki demande mpo na kozwa matomba ya ntango mokuse ya kozanga mosala mpe bato ya Grande-Bretagne milio 1 oyo basalaka mosala basalaki demande mpo babimisa mwanga ya kodefisa bango mbongo. Katikati ya milio moko ya bakompani ya Allemagne basengaki bato na bango ya mosala baluka lisalisi na manaka ya ntango mokuse oyo babengaka Kurzarbeit.
The German short-time work compensation scheme has been adopted by France and Britain.
Bato ya France mpe Grande-Bretagne bandima kosalela mobeko ya Allemagne oyo etali kofuta mbongo na ntango mokuse.
The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organizations' operations as well as individuals—both employed and independent—globally.

Misala ya art mpe ya makambo ya bonkoko ebebisami makasi na maladi mabe oyo; ezonyokola masanga mpe bato mokomoko, eza baoyo bazali na mosala mpe baoyo basalaka misala na bango moko, na mokili mobimba.

Arts and culture sector organizations attempted to uphold their (often publicly funded) mission to provide access to cultural heritage to the community, maintain the safety of their employees and the public, and support artists where possible.

Bato ya misala ya art mpe ya culture bamekaki kolanda kosala misala na bango (oyo mbala mingi mbongo eutaka na bato) mpo na kolanda kosepelisa bato ya bisika bafandi, kosala ete bato na bango ya mosala mpe bato nyonso bazala na libateli, mpe kosalisa ba-artiste soki likoki ezali.

By March 2020, across the world and to varying degrees, museums, libraries, performance venues, and other cultural institutions had been indefinitely closed with their exhibitions, events and performances cancelled or postponed.

Na sanza ya misato 2020, na mokili mobimba mpe na banivo ekeseni, ba musee, babiblioteke, bisika ya masano, mpe bisika mosusu ya culture, bakanga yango mpenza; mpe biloko oyo bato bayaka kotala, masano oyo basalaka kuna ekosalema te to babongoli date na yango.

In response there were intensive efforts to provide alternative services through digital platforms.Another recent and rapidly accelerating fallout of the disease is the cancellation of religious services, major events in sports, and other social events, such as music festivals and concerts, technology conferences, and fashion shows.

Yango wana, bato basalaki milende mingi mpo na kozwa mwango mosusu ya kosala mosala na nzela ya internet. Likambo mosusu ya mpasi eza ndenge bapekisa mangomba basala makita te, bapekisa makambo ya sports, mpe makambo mosusu ya bomoi ya bato, na ndakisa bafete ya miziki mpe ba concert, makita ya technologie mpe ba defile de mode.

The film industry has also experienced disruption.The Vatican announced that Holy Week observances in Rome, which occur during the last week of the Christian penitential season of Lent, have been cancelled.
Mosala ya bafilme mpe ezosalama lisusu te. Vatican elobaki ete bafete ya mposo ya mosantu na Rome, oyo esalemaka na mposo ya nsuka ya eleko ya kokila bilei, ekosalema te.

Many dioceses have recommended older Christians to stay at home rather than attending Mass on Sundays; some churches have made church services available via radio, online live streaming or television while others are offering drive-in worship.

Badiocese mingi esengi Bakristo oyo baza mibange bafanda olie ya kokende na misa na mikolo ya Eyenga; mangombe mosusu bazosala makita na bango na nzela ya radio, na internet na steaming en direct to na televizio mpe basusu bazosala makita na balabala.

With the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome closing its churches and chapels and St. Peter's Square emptied of Christian pilgrims, other religious bodies also cancelled services and limited public gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and gurdwaras.

Badiocese ya Katolika ya Roma ekangaki bandako ya nzambe na yango mpe St. Peter’s Square ebimisaki Bakristo mpo etikala mpamba, mangomba mosusu mpe bakati makita na bango mpe etya mibeko na makita ya bato nyonso na ndako ya nzambe, na ba mosquee, na basinagoge, na batempelo mpe na ba-eklezia.

Iran's Health Ministry announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in areas affected by the outbreak and shrines were later closed, while Saudi Arabia banned the entry of foreign pilgrims as well as its residents to holy sites in Mecca and Medina.

Ministre ya kolongono ya nzoto ya Iran alobaki ete losambo ya mokolo ya mitano na bisika oyo virisi ezali ekosalema lisusu te mpe bakangaki batempelo na nsima, kasi Arabie Saudite episi bana-mboka mpe bapaya na kokende na losambo Mecque mpe Medine.
The pandemic has caused the most significant disruption to the worldwide sporting calendar since the Second World War.
Maladi oyo ebebisi mpenza manaka ya sport na mokili mobimba koleka banda etumba ya mibale ya mokili mobimba.
Most major sporting events have been either cancelled or postponed, including the 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019–20 NBA season, and 2019–20 NHL season.

Ba evenement mingi ya sport bakati yango to tabongoli date na yango, na ndakisa Champions League ya 2019-20 ya UEFA, Championnat ya Angleterre ya 2019-20, Euro 2020 ya UEFA, saison 2019-20 ya NBA, mpe saison 2019-20 ya NHL.

The outbreak disrupted plans for the 2020 Summer Olympics, which were originally scheduled to start at the end of July; the International Olympic Committee announced on 24 March that the event will be "rescheduled to a date beyond 2020 but not later than summer 2021".Casinos and other gaming venues worldwide have closed and live poker tournaments have been either postponed or cancelled.

Kobima ya maladi oyo ebebisi programe ya jeux olympique ya eleko ya molunge 2020, oyo esengelaki kobanda mpe kosuka na nsuka ya sanza ya nsambo; Comité olympique international elobaki na mokolo ya 24 sanza ya misato ete bakotya "date ya sika na nsima ya 2020 kasi ekozala liboso ya eleko ya molunge 2021". Masano ya casino mpe bisika mosusu ya masano na mokili mobimba bakangi yango mpe masano ya pocker en direct babongoli date na yango to ekosalema lisusu te.

This has led many gamblers to move online, with many online gambling sites reporting significant increases in their rates of new sign-ups.The entertainment industry has also been affected, with various music groups suspending or cancelling concert tours.

Yango esali ete bato mingi bakoma kosala masono na internet, mpe basite mingi ya masano na internet ekomi na bato mingi mpenza ya sika. Industrie ya masano mpe ezonyokwama, bituluku mingi ya miziki bazwi congé to bakati ba tournée na bango ya ba concert.
Many large theatres such as those on Broadway also suspended all performances.
Bisika mingi ya minene ya teyatre na ndakisa oyo ya Broadway mpe elobi ete masano nyonso ekosalema te.

Some artists have explored ways to continue to produce and share work over the internet as an alternative to traditional live performance, such as live streaming concerts or creating web-based "festivals" for artists to perform, distribute, and publicize their work.

Ba-artiste mosusu bazoluka ndenge ya kolanda kobeta miziki mpe kokabola misala na bango na internet olie ya kosala ba concert en direct, na ndakisa bazobeta ba concert na streaming en direct to bazosala “bafeti” na internet mpo ba artiste babeta ba concert, mpe kosala piblisite ya mosala na bango.
Online, numerous coronavirus-themed Internet memes have spread as many turn to humour and distraction amid uncertainty.
Na internet, masolo mingi oyo ezolobela coronavirisi etondi mpo bato mosusu bakomisi yango lisolo ya kosekisa mpe eleko ya kolekisela ntango ata toyebi te ndenge ekosuka.

Since the outbreak of COVID-19, heightened prejudice, xenophobia, and racism have been noted toward people of Chinese and East Asian descent, and against people from hotspots in Europe, the United States and other countries.

Banda kobima ya COVID-19, bato bakomi koyina makasi, kozwa makanisi mabe, mpe koyina mpo na mposo ya nzoto bato ya Chine mpe bato oyo bankoko na bango bauta na Asie ya este, mpe bato ya Eropa, ya Éats-Unis mpe ya mikili mosusu oyo maladi wana ezali mingi.
Incidents of fear, suspicion, and hostility have been observed in many countries, particularly in Europe, East Asia, North America, and the Asia-Pacific region.

Bapanzi-nsango emonisi ete na mikili mingi, mingimingi na Eropa, na Asie ya este, na Amerique ya norde, mpe na mikili ya Asie Pacifique, makambo ya kobangisa bato, ya kozwela bango makanisi mabe, mpe ya koyina bango emonani mingi.

Reports from February (when the majority of the cases had still been confined to China) have documented racist sentiments expressed in various groups worldwide of Chinese people deserving the virus or receiving what has been claimed as justified retribution.

Barapore ya sanza ya mibale (ntango bato mingi ya maladi bazalaki kaka na Chine) elobelaki mayoki ya koyina bato ya Chine euti na mokili mobimba, mpe bato mingi bazalaki koloba ete ebongi mpenza virisi wana ezwa bato ya Chine mpo na kofuta bango.
Some countries in Africa have also seen a rise in anti-Chinese sentiment.
Na mikili mosusu ya Afrika mpe bakomi koyina mingi bato ya Chine.
Many residents of Wuhan and Hubei have reported discrimination based on their regional origin.
Bato mingi ya Wuhan mpe ya Hubei balobi ete bato bazomona bango mpamba mpo na esika bauta.
There has been support for the Chinese, both on and offline, and towards those in virus-stricken areas.
Bato mingi bazopesa bato ya Chine maboko, na internet mpe na libanda ya internet mpe bazosunga baoyo bazali na bamboka oyo virisi ezali.

Following the progression of the outbreak to new hotspot countries, people from Italy, the first country in Europe to experience a serious outbreak of COVID-19, could also be subjected to suspicion and xenophobia.Citizens in countries including Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, and South Korea initially signed petitions lobbying to ban Chinese people from entering their countries in an effort to stop the disease.

Na kotalela bokoli ya virisi na mikili oyo ekoti mingi, bato ya Italie, mokili ya liboso ya Eropa oyo maladi ya COVID-19 ezwaki bato mingi, bato bakoki mpe kokoma mpe kobanda koyina bango mpe kozwela bango makanisi mabe. Bato ya mikili lokola Malaisie, Nouvelle-Zelande, Singapour, mpe Corée ya sude batyaki maboko na mokanda mpo na kopekisa bato ya Chine na kokota na mboka na bango mpo na kosilisa maladi wana.
In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan trended on Twitter.
Na Japon, bazokoma na Twitter #BatoyaChineBoyaTenaJapon ezotambola mingi.
Chinese people as well as other Asians in the United Kingdom and the United States have reported increasing levels of racist abuse, as well as assaults.
Bato ya Chine mpe bato mosusu ya Asie oyo baza na Royaume-Uni mpe na États-Unis balobi ete bato bakomi koyina bango mingi mpo na mposo na bango mpe bazoluka kosala bango mabe.
U.S. president Donald Trump has faced criticism for referring to the coronavirus as the "Chinese Virus", a term considered by critics to be racist and anti-Chinese.
Prezida ya États-Unis Donald Trump abengaki coronavirisi ‘’virisi ya bato ya Chine’’, maloba oyo bato balobi eza koyina bato ya mpo na mposo na bango mpe koyina bango mpenza.
Protesters in Ukraine attacked buses carrying Ukrainian and foreign evacuees from Wuhan to Novi Sanzhary.
Na Ukraine bato babundisaki babisi oyo ezalaki komema bato ya Ukraine mpe bapaya oyo bawutaki Wuhan, ezalaki komema bango na Novi Sanzhary.
Students who come from Northeast India, which shares a border with China, and study in major Indian cities have reportedly experienced harassment related to the coronavirus outbreak.
Bana ya kelasi oyo bawutaki na norde este ya Inde, oyo ekaboli ndelo na Chine, mpe bayekolaka na bingumba minenne ya Inde balobi ete bato bazonykola bango mpe na kobima ya coronavirisi.
The Bharatiya Janata Party's State unit president in West Bengal Dilip Ghosh stated that the Chinese had destroyed nature and "that's why the God took revenge against them."
Prezida ya parti ya etuka ya Bharatiya Janata na West Bengal Dilip Ghosh alobaki ete bato ya Chine babebisi mokili “yango wana Nzambe azopesa bango etumbu.”

The remarks were later condemned by the Chinese consulate in Kolkata, calling it "erroneous".In China, xenophobia and racism agains non-Chinese residents has been inflamed by the pandemic, with foreigners described as "foreign garbage" and targeted for "disposal".

Consolat ya Chine na Kolkata, akweisaka makambo mpe alobaki te eza “libunga.” Na Chine, xenophobie mpe racisme epai ya bato oyo bafandaka te na Chine ekomi mingi mpo na maladi oyo, mpe bazobenga bapaya “bosoto ya bapaya” mpe baza na likanisi ya “kobwaka” bango.
Many newspapers with paywalls have removed them for some or all of their coronavirus coverage.
Bazulunalu mingi oyo eza na paywalls elongoli makambo mosusu to nyonso oyo balobaki mpo na coromavirisi.
Many scientific publishers made scientific papers related to the outbreak available with open access.
Bato mingi oyo babimisaka bansango ya siansi basali mikanda ezolobela maladi oyo mpe moto nyonso akoki kotanga yango ya ofele.
Some scientists chose to share their results quickly on preprint servers such as bioRxiv.
Bato mosusu ya siansi baponi kotya ba résultat na bango noki na bisika neti bioRxiv.
Emerging infectious disease – Infectious disease of emerging pathogen, often novel in its outbreak range or transmission mode
Maladi mabe oyo ezobima - maladi mabe oyo ezouta na bavirisi, mbala mingi eza lolenge ya sika to ezopesama na lolenge ya sika
Globalization and disease – Overview of globalization and disease transmission
Mokili mobimba mpe maladi - Botaleli ya maladi na mokili mobimba mpe ndenge ezopanzana
List of epidemics and pandemics – A list of death tolls due to infectious disease
Bankombo ya maladi mpe maladi mabe - Liste ya motango ya bato bakufi mpo bazwaki maladi yango
Wildlife smuggling and zoonoses – Health risks associated with the trade in exotic wildlife
Kobebisa biloko ya zamba me banyama - Makama ya kolongonoo ya nzoto euti na koteka banyama ya zamba

Laboratory testing for the respiratory coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the associated SARS-CoV-2 virus includes methods that detect the presence of virus and those that detect antibodies produced in response to infection.

Ba-ekzame ya maladi ya mpema ya coronavirisi 2019 (COVID-19) mpe ya virisi SARS-CoV-2 oyo eza na boyokani na yango etaleli mpe mayele ya koyeba virisi mpe mayele ya koyeba ba anticorps oyo ebotamaka mpo na kobundisa maladi.
The presence of viruses in samples is confirmed by RT-PCR, which detects the coronavirus' RNA.
Kozala ya virisi na kati ya ba échantillon endimisami na RT-PCR, oyo emonaka coronavirisi RNA.
This test is specific and is designed to only detect the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
Ekzame oyo eza ya sikisiki mpe mokano na yango eza kaka ya komona RNA ya virisi SARS-COV-2.
It is used to confirm very recent or active infections.
Basalelaka yango mpo na komona maladi ya sika to maladi ya kala oyo eza na nzoto.
Detection of antibodies (serology) can be used both for diagnosis and population surveillance.
Komona ba anticorps (serologie) ekoki kosalema mpo na diagnostic mpe kokengela bato.
Antibody tests show how many people have had the disease, including those whose symptoms were too minor to report or who were asymptomatic.
Ekzame ya ba anticorps elakisaka motango ya bato oyo bazali na maladi, ata mpe baoyo bilembo na yango eza moke mpenza mpo emonana to oyo baza te na bilembo na yango.
An accurate mortality rate of the disease and the level of herd immunity in the population can be determined from the results of this test.
Taux ya solo ya bato bazokufa na maladi oyo mpe nivo ya immunité ya bato nyonso ekoki koyebana na ba résulat ya ekzame oyo.
Due to limited testing, as of March 2020 no countries had reliable data on the prevalence of the virus in their population.
Lokola ba-ekzame ezali kosalema mingi te, na sanza ya misato 2020 ata mokili moko te ezalaki na bansango ya solo ezomonisa ndenge virisi ezopalangana kati na bato na bango.
By 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of their population, and there are massive variations in how much testing has been done across countries.
Na mokolo ya 23 sanza ya misato, ata mokili moko te esalaki ekzame na bato na bango 3%, mpe bokeseni eza mingi na ndenge mikili mingi ezalaki kosala ekzame oyo.
This variability is also likely to be significantly affecting reported case fatality rates, which are likely to be significantly over-estimated in some countries.
Bokeseni oyo ekoki kozala mpe na bopusi makasi na taux ya liwa, oyo ndenge ezomonana ekozala moke mpenza na mikili mingi.
Using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) the test can be done on respiratory samples obtained by various methods, including nasopharyngeal swab or sputum sample.

Na kosalela ndenge makambo esalemaka na nsima ya ekzame ya transcription ya kobaluka ya polymerase (rRT-PCR) ekoki kosalema na ba échantilon ya mpema oyo bazwaki na lolenge mingi, ata mpe kozwa ndambo ya miyoyo kati na zolo to échantillon ya kosukosu.
Results are generally available within a few hours to 2 days.
Mbala mingi ba résultat ebimaka nsima ya mwa bangonga to mikolo 2.
The RT-PCR test performed with throat swabs is only reliable in the first week of the disease.
Ekzame ya RT-PCR oyo esalemi na kosukosu ebimisaka résultat ya malamu kaka soki maladi eza na mposo ya liboso.
Later on the virus can disappear in the throat while it continues to multiply in the lungs.
Na nsima virisi ekoki kolimwa na mongongo kasi ezokoba kobotama na bapoumon.
For infected people tested in the second week, alternatively sample material can then be taken from the deep airways by suction catheter or coughing up material (sputum) can be used.
Mpo na bato ya maladi oyo basali ekzame na mposo ya mibale, bakoki kosala yango na kozwana mayi na kati mpenza ya nzela ya kopema ya kati na nzela ya cathetere to mayi ya kosokusu.

One of the early PCR tests was developed at Charité in Berlin in January 2020 using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR), and formed the basis of 250,000 kits for distribution by the World Health Organization (WHO).

Moko ya ekzame ya PCR ya liboso babandisaki yango na Charité na Berlin na sanza ya yambo 2020 na kosalelaka makambo esalemaka na nsima ya transcription ya kobaluka ya polymerase (rRT-PCR), mpe esalaki na kosala biloko 250 000 ya kosala ekzame oyo organisation mondiale de la santé (OMS) ekabolaki.

The United Kingdom had also developed a test by 23 January 2020.The South Korean company Kogenebiotech developed a clinical grade, PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit (PowerChek Coronavirus) on 28 January 2020.

Royaume-Uni esalaki mpe biloko ya ekzame na mokolo ya 23 sanza ya yambo 2020. Kompani moko ya Corée ya sude Kogenebioch esalaki apareyi moko, PC -ewuta na SARS-CoV-2 (PowerChek Coronavirisi) na mokolo ya 28 sanza ya yambo 2020.

It looks for the "E" gene shared by all beta coronaviruses, and the RdRp gene specific to SARS-CoV-2.In China, BGI Group was one of the first companies to receive emergency use approval from China's National Medical Products Administration for a PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit.In the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is distributing its 2019-Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel to public health labs through the International Reagent Resource.

Elukakaba gene “E” nyonso oyo eza na ba coronavirisi beta nyonso mpe ba gene RdRp ya sikisiki ya SARS-CoV-2. Na Chine, lisanga BGI ezalaki kompani ya liboso oyo oyo bazwaki ndingisa ya lisanga elandelaka makambo nyonso ya bankisi na Chine mpo na kosala apareyi ya PCR mpo kosala ekzame ya SARS-COV-2. Na États-Unis, bacentre ya kolandela mpe kobundisa maladi (CDC) ezali kokabola biloko na yango kosala ekzame ya coronavirisi ya sika-2019 (2019-nCoV) na ntango ya solo RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel na balaboratoire yato nyonso na lisalisi ya International Reagent Resource.

One of three genetic tests in older versions of the test kits caused inconclusive results due to faulty reagents, and a bottleneck of testing at the CDC in Atlanta; this resulted in an average of fewer than 100 samples a day being successfully processed throughout the whole of February 2020.

Na ba-ekzame na biso misato ya gene na bamodele ya kala, biloko ya kosala ekzame ezalaki kobimisa ba résultat ya malamu te, mpe mpasi mpasi ya kosala ekzame na CDC na Atlanda; esalaki ete basala ba-ekzame na ba échantillon 100 na mokolo na sanza ya mibale 2020.
Tests using two components were not determined to be reliable until 28 February 2020, and it was not until then that state and local laboratories were permitted to begin testing.

Kosalela biloko mibale ntango mpo na kosala ba ekzame emonanaki ete ezosala malamu te na mokolo ya 28 sanza ya mibale 2020, mpe nsima na yango nde balaboratoire ya etuka mpe ya bamboka bazwaki ndingisa ya kobanda kosala ba ekzama.
The test was approved by the Food and Drug Administration under an Emergency Use Authorization.US commercial labs began testing in early March 2020.
Ministere ya Bilei mpe Bankisi endimaka ba ekzame na nse ya ndingisa ya mbalakaka. Balaboratoire ya Etats-Unis ebandaki kosalisa ba ekzame na ebandeli ya sanza ya misato 2020.
As of 5 March 2020 LabCorp announced nationwide availability of COVID-19 testing based on RT-PCR.
Na mokolo ya 5 sanza ya misato 2020 LabCorp elobaki ete bato ya mboka mobimba bakoki kobanda kosala ekzame ya COVID-19 na lisalisi ya RT-PCR.
Quest Diagnostics similarly made nationwide COVID-19 testing available as of 9 March 2020.
Ndenge moko, Quest Diagnostics endimaka babanda kosala bato nyonso ya mboka ba ekzame COVID-19 na mokolo ya 9 sanza ya misato 2020.
No quantity limitations were announced; specimen collection and processing must be performed according to CDC requirements.
Balobaki te motango ya nsuka; kozwa ba echantillon mpe kosala ba ekzame esengeli kosalama na kolanda mibeko ya CDC.
In Russia, the COVID-19 test was developed and produced by the State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR.
Na Russie, basalaki biloko ya kosalisa ekzame ya COVID-19 na centre ya bolukiluki ya bavirisi mpe biotecnologie VECTOR.

On 11 February 2020 the test was registered by the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare.On 12 March 2020, Mayo Clinic was reported to have developed a test to detect COVID-19 infection.On 13 March 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for a test which could be performed within 3.5 hours in high volume, thus allowing one machine to do approximately 4,128 tests in a 24-hour period.

Na mokolo ya 11 sanza ya mibale 2020 ministere ekengelaka kolongono ya nzoto endimaka kosalisa ba ekzame. Na mokolo ya 12 sanza ya misato 2020, balobaki ete lopitalo Mayo ebimisaka mashine ya kosala ekzame ya COVID-19. Na mokolo ya 13 sanza ya misato 2020, FDA endimaki ete Roch Diagnostics basala ba ekzame oyo basengelaki kosala na bangonga 3,5 na motango ya mingi, epesaki mashine moko libaku ya kosala ba ekzame pene ya 4 128 na eleko ya bangonga 24.

On 19 March 2020, the FDA issued emergency use authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for a test on Abbott's m2000 system; the FDA had previously issued similar authorization to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.
Na mokolo ya 19 sanza ya misato 2020, FDA endimaki ete balaboratoire ya Abbott esala ekzame na systeme ya Abbott ya m2000; FDA esi endimaki basalela Hologic, LabCorp, mpe Thermo Fisher Scientific.
On 21 March 2020, Cepheid similarly received EUA from the FDA for a test that takes about 45 minutes.
Na mokolo ya 21 sanza ya misato 2020, Cepheid mpe azwaki ndingisa ya EUA ewutaki na FDA mpo na kosala ekzame oyo ewumelaka kaka miniti 45.
The FDA has approved a test that uses isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology instead of PCR.
FDA endimaki basala ekzame oyo esengaka kosalela mayele ya aside isothermique nucleique na esika ya PCR.
Since this does not require a series of alternating temperature cycles this method can deliver positive results in as little as five minutes and negative results in 13 minutes.
Lokolo esengaka te kobongolaka temperature, metode oyo ekoki kopesa resultat ya bato oyo baza na maladi na nse ya miniti mitano mpe ya bato oyo baza na yango te na nse ya miniti 13.

There are currently about 18,000 of these machines in the U.S. and Abbott expects to ramp up manufacturing to deliver 50,000 tests per day.A test which uses a monoclonal antibody which specifically binds to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the novel coronavirus is being developed in Taiwan, with the hope that it can provide results in 15 to 20 minutes just like a rapid influenza test.

Eza sikoyo na bamashine peno ya 18 000 na Etats-Unis mpe bato ya mayele ya Abbott bakosala ba ekzame 50 000 na mokolo moko. Ekzame oyo basalelaka anticorps moko boye elongo na baproteine ya nuclecapside (proteine N) ya cornovirisi ya sika, baza na ksoala yango na Taiwan, na elikya ete ekoki kobimisa ba resultat nsima ya miniti 15 to 20 kaka ndenge ezalaka mpo na ekzame ya grippe.
A March 2020 literature review concluded that "chest radiographs are of little diagnostic value in early stages, whereas CT [computed tomography] findings may be present even before symptom onset."

Na sanza ya misato 2020 zulunalu elobaki ete “ba ekzame ya radio ya ntolo eza na ntina mingi te na bitambe ya ebandeli, kasi CT [tomographie esalamaka na ordinatere] ekoki kozala ata liboso bilembo ebanda komonana.”
Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacificities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution.
Biloko ya CT eza na ndakisa batala-tala ya multilateral ya pete elongo na peripherique, asymetrique mpe elongo ya libanda.
Subpleural dominance, crazy paving and consolidation develop as the disease evolves.
Sous-pleural ezalaka monene, nguya ya makasi mpenza mpe bokasi ntango maladi ezopalangana.

A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan at the point of origin of the current pandemic has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.

Bolukiluki moko oyo ekokanisaki PCR na CT na Wuhan na ebandeli ya maladi oyo elobi ete CT eza makasi mingi koleka PCR, kasi eza na ba resultat ya sikisiki te, mpe bafoto na yango mosusu elekaka likolo ya maladi ya pneumonie mpe maladi mosusu.

As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".As of March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR for initial screening.

Na sanza ya misato 2020, College ya Amerika ya radiologie elobaki ete “basalela CT te mpo na mpo na komona to neti ekzame ya liboso mpo na komona COVID-19.” Na sanza ya misato 2020, CDC elobaki bato basalela PCR na ebandeli.
Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies including IgM and IgG.
